event.description: The video starts on the Vibe Manager home screen, with a task focused on fixing mobile website UI spacing.
The user's cursor moves to the 'Record' icon next to the Task Description.
The user clicks the 'Record' icon, and a 'Record Screen for Analysis' modal appears.
The user begins typing in the 'Analysis Prompt' text field.
The user finishes typing the prompt: 'Please only focus on what UI inconsistencies you actually can see.'
The user clicks and drags the 'Frame Rate (FPS)' slider to the right.
The user releases the slider, setting the FPS to 24.
The user clicks the 'Start Recording' button.
A native macOS screen sharing dialog appears.
The user clicks the 'Share this entire window' button to begin the capture.
A red recording indicator appears in the bottom-right corner of the Vibe Manager window.
The user opens the Control Center on their mirrored iPhone.
The user taps on the 'Screen Mirroring' option.
The iPhone screen mirroring connects, displaying the Safari browser open to 'vibemanager.app'.
The user begins scrolling down the mobile website.
The user scrolls past the 'Download for Mac' button to the 'Key Features' section.
The user scrolls past the 'Never Start from Scratch' feature card.
The user scrolls to the 'How it Works' section.
The user scrolls to the 'No-Nonsense Pricing' section.
The user scrolls to the 'Frequently Asked Questions' section.
The user expands the 'What else?' FAQ item.
The user expands the third FAQ item.
The user scrolls to the 'Built for You, With You' section in the footer.
The user begins scrolling back up the mobile website.
The user scrolls back up to the 'How it Works' section for a visual comparison.
The user opens the Control Center on the iPhone again.
The user taps 'Stop Mirroring'.
The user clicks the red 'Stop' button in the Vibe Manager app to end the recording.
A new 'Analyzing video...' task appears in the 'Background Tasks' list with a progress bar.
The user clicks on the 'Analyzing video...' task.
A 'Job Details' modal opens, showing the job status as 'Running'.
The user expands the 'Video Preview' accordion.
The user clicks 'Play' on the video preview and watches the recording.
The user collapses the 'Video Preview' accordion.
The user expands the 'Prompt' accordion to see the text that was sent to the AI.
The user closes the 'Job Details' modal.
A 'Video Analysis Complete' notification appears. The main 'Task Description' area is populated with the AI's findings, including a 'Temporal Sequence'.
The user scrolls down below the analysis and clicks the 'Find Relevant Files' button.
The user clicks on the now-completed 'Video Analysis' job in the left panel.
In the 'Job Details' modal, the user expands the 'Response' section to view the full, raw output from the AI model.
The user closes the 'Job Details' modal.
The user clicks the 'Credits: $120.06' button in the header.
The 'Billing History' modal opens to the 'Transactions' tab.
The user clicks on the 'Usage Details' tab.
The user closes the 'Billing History' modal.
In the left panel, the user clicks the 'Use Files' button on a completed 'AI File Relevance Assessment' task.
The user clicks 'Use Files' on another completed assessment, adding more files to the main context.
In the 'Search Files...' results, the user checks the box for 'FAQ.tsx'.
The user checks the box for 'Features.tsx'.
The user checks the boxes for 'HowItWorks.tsx' and 'GlassCard.tsx'.
The user checks the box for 'tailwind.config.ts'.
The user scrolls down and clicks the 'Create Implementation Plan' button.
Three parallel 'Generating implementation plan...' tasks appear, each using a different AI model.
After the plans complete, the user clicks 'View Content' for the first plan.
A modal opens showing the detailed implementation plan. The user scrolls through the generated code modifications.
The user closes the plan viewer.
The user selects the checkboxes for all three generated plans.
The user clicks the 'Merge Plans' button.
A 'Merging implementation plans...' task begins processing.
The merge task finishes, and a new 'Merged' plan appears in the list.
The user clicks 'View Content' on the successfully merged plan.
After thoroughly scrolling through the lengthy merged plan, the user closes the plan viewer.
The user scrolls up to the main 'Task Description' section.
The user clicks at the end of the AI-generated text and manually types a new line.
The user finishes typing: 'Please be sure to utilize the best tailwind practices.'
The user navigates to the 'Settings' page.
The user clicks on 'Relevance Assessment' to view its system prompt.
The user clicks on 'Implementation Plans' to view its system prompt and model parameters.
The user clicks through other settings like 'Voice Transcription' and 'Video Analysis'.
The user navigates to the 'Account' page.
The user scrolls down the Account page, viewing billing, credits, and auto top-off settings.
The user navigates to the 'Feedback' page.
A feedback widget from 'featurebase.app' loads within the application.
The user clicks the 'Home' icon to return to the main project screen.
The video ends.
